article.title: Project is closed, software life cycle is not
article.label: Delivery and Warranty
article.intro: Read more about Deliverables and warranty services we provide
article.keywords: software quality, warranty, software testing, continuous integration, software outsourcing, offshore development, distributed programming,

text.p: As stated in our software development contract, a software project is closed when [Quality]({% href process/quality %}) is acceptable. That means that 95% of functional [SRS]({% href process/scope/requirement}">Requirements from <a href="${url:process/scope/srs %}) do not have any [Defects]({% href process/quality/defect %}).

Since 100% Quality is not attainable, [Deliverables]({% href process/warranty/deliverables %}) have many more Defects than you or our testers can reveal in a limited amount of [time]({% href process/time %}). Project acceptance criteria is a situation when Deliverables do not have critical Defects that block product release.
We provide defect removal service free of charge during one calendar year after project completion. Such service includes removal of any Defects you find in Deliverables.

There is a difference between Defect removal and [support services]({% href process/warranty/support %}). We do not provide [support services]({% href process/warranty/support %}), which include server administration, end-user support, search engine optimization, etc.

concepts.c1: Specification defines the scope that is guaranteed to be Defect-free
concepts.c2: Deliverables are sent to the customer when a project is closed
concepts.c3: Product lifecycle is not finished when the project is closed
